memberdef.definition: typedef void(* TriggerCallback) (PhysicsContext *pctx, dGeomID trigger, dGeomID intruder)
memberdef.name: TriggerCallback

briefdescription.para: Function pointer type for physics trigger events.

listitem.para:
This callback is triggered when a geometry designated as a "ghost" or sensor overlaps with another geometry. When this callback is set in geomInfo, the physics engine will skip standard contact resolution, allowing objects to pass through while still notifying game logic.
trigger
The dGeomID of the geometry that has the callback assigned.
intruder
The dGeomID of the geometry that entered or is inside the trigger.
If the triggering geom is attached to a body, the trigger will follow the body's transform.
The physics context is passed with the callback, which has a user data pointer this can be used to avoid having to use global variables in the callback
geomInfo

briefdescription.para: Stores geometry metadata for collision, texturing, and trimesh data.

listitem.para: This structure encapsulates everything needed to render and handle physics for a specific piece of geometry, including UV scaling and raw mesh indices.

briefdescription.para: Create a base entity with physics body.

detaileddescription.para: Internal helper function that creates a new entity with an ODE body and adds it to the physics world's object list. This reduces code duplication across all shape creation functions.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the physics context

simplesect.para: Pointer to newly created entity
Internal function - but might be useful for manual creation

memberdef.argsstring: (bool collidable, Texture *texture, float uvScaleU, float uvScaleV)
memberdef.name: CreateGeomInfo

briefdescription.para: Helper to allocate geomInfo with collision flag, optional texture, and UV scale this is useful when greating your own custom bodies for special purposes If this is attached to a geom on a body that is in the global entity list then this allocation will be automagically cleaned up.

parameterdescription.para: should this geom cause collisions
which texture to use for the geom
texture scaling
texture scaling

memberdef.argsstring: (PhysicsContext *physCtx, GraphicsContext *gfxCtx, Model model, Texture *tex, float uvScale)
memberdef.name: CreateStaticTrimesh

briefdescription.para: Create a static trimesh collision geometry from a model.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a static trimesh (triangle mesh) collision geometry from a RayLib model. This allows arbitrary 3D models to be used as static collision objects in the physics simulation. The mesh is optimized for collision detection but does not move or respond to physics.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the physics context
Pointer to the graphics context
RayLib model to create collision geometry from
Optional texture to apply to the mesh (can be NULL)
UV scaling factor for texture tiling

simplesect.para: Pointer to the created node in the statics list
The mesh is static and cannot be moved after creation
Supports custom textures and UV scaling for visual appearance
Stores model data for rendering with custom shaders
Model

memberdef.argsstring: (PhysicsContext *ctx, GraphicsContext *gfxCtx, Vector3 size, Vector3 pos, Vector3 rot, float mass)
memberdef.name: CreateBox

briefdescription.para: Add a box-shaped physics body to the world.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new dynamic box in the physics simulation with the specified dimensions, position, rotation, and mass. The box is automatically added to the rendering list and collision detection system.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the physics context
Pointer to the graphics context for texture assignment
Dimensions of the box (width, height, depth)
Initial position of the box center
Initial rotation (Euler angles: pitch, yaw, roll)
Mass of the box (0 for static object)

simplesect.para: Pointer to the newly created entity
Box is assigned a random texture from the available box textures

memberdef.argsstring: (PhysicsContext *ctx, GraphicsContext *gfxCtx, float radius, Vector3 pos, Vector3 rot, float mass)
memberdef.name: CreateSphere

briefdescription.para: Add a sphere-shaped physics body to the world.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new dynamic sphere in the physics simulation with the specified radius, position, rotation, and mass. Spheres are efficient for collision detection and are commonly used for balls and round objects.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the physics context
Pointer to the graphics context for texture assignment
Radius of the sphere
Initial position of the sphere center
Initial rotation (Euler angles)
Mass of the sphere (0 for static object)

simplesect.para: Pointer to the newly created entity
Sphere is assigned a random texture from the available sphere textures

memberdef.argsstring: (PhysicsContext *ctx, GraphicsContext *gfxCtx, float radius, float length, Vector3 pos, Vector3 rot, float mass)
memberdef.name: CreateCylinder

briefdescription.para: Add a cylinder-shaped physics body to the world.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new dynamic cylinder in the physics simulation with the specified radius, length, position, rotation, and mass. ODE cylinders are aligned along the Z-axis by default.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the physics context
Pointer to the graphics context for texture assignment
Radius of the cylinder
Length of the cylinder (along Z-axis)
Initial position of the cylinder center
Initial rotation (Euler angles)
Mass of the cylinder (0 for static object)

simplesect.para: Pointer to the newly created entity
Cylinder is aligned along Z-axis as per ODE convention
Cylinder is assigned a random texture from the available cylinder textures

memberdef.argsstring: (PhysicsContext *ctx, GraphicsContext *gfxCtx, float radius, float length, Vector3 pos, Vector3 rot, float mass)
memberdef.name: CreateCapsule

briefdescription.para: Add a capsule-shaped physics body to the world.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a new dynamic capsule in the physics simulation. Capsules are useful for character controllers and objects that need smooth collision with the ground.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the physics context
Pointer to the graphics context for texture assignment
Radius of the capsule caps
Length of the cylindrical portion
Initial position of the capsule center
Initial rotation (Euler angles)
Mass of the capsule (0 for static object)

simplesect.para: Pointer to the newly created entity
Capsule combines a cylinder with two hemispherical ends

memberdef.argsstring: (PhysicsContext *ctx, GraphicsContext *gfxCtx, float shaftRad, float shaftLen, float endRad, Vector3 pos, Vector3 rot, float mass)
memberdef.name: CreateDumbbell

briefdescription.para: Add a dumbbell-shaped composite physics body.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a composite physics body consisting of a cylindrical shaft with two spherical ends. This demonstrates how to create custom composite shapes by combining multiple geometries.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the physics context
Pointer to the graphics context for texture assignment
Radius of the cylindrical shaft
Length of the cylindrical shaft
Radius of the end spheres
Initial position of the dumbbell center
Initial rotation (Euler angles)
Total mass of the dumbbell

simplesect.para: Pointer to the newly created entity
This is an example of creating composite shapes
Mass is distributed: 50% shaft, 25% each end

memberdef.argsstring: (PhysicsContext *ctx, GraphicsContext *gfxCtx, Vector3 pos, unsigned char mask)
memberdef.name: CreateRandomEntity

briefdescription.para: Add a random physics object at the specified position.

detaileddescription.para: Creates a random physics body (box, sphere, cylinder, capsule, or dumbbell) at the given position. Useful for testing and creating dynamic scenes without manually specifying each object.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the physics context
Pointer to the graphics context
Position where the random object should be created
which shapes to choose from SHAPE_ALL for all of them SHAPE & ~SHAPE_CAPSULE for all but capsule etc

simplesect.para: Pointer to the newly created entity
Distribution: 20% boxes, 20% spheres, 20% cylinders, 20% capsules, 20% dumbbells
Mass is fixed at 10.0f for all random objects
Each type has randomized dimensions within reasonable ranges

briefdescription.para: this will return the first entity that the camera is directly pointed at while useful in the examples and likely for other things, it also serves as an example of how you can do this yourself for other things

parameterdescription.para: the physics context (global physics info)
the graphics context (global info usful for graphics)
pass a pointer to a Vector3 this will be set with the location of the intersecton

simplesect.para: a pointer to the entity that was found.

briefdescription.para: changes the hew (tint) of all entities geoms

detaileddescription.para: go through each geom attached to the entities body and change their hew or tint

parameterdescription.para: pointer to the entity
new colour to use

briefdescription.para: crates a rotor joint the joint is created with the anchor at the from enties location

parameterdescription.para: physics context holds all the physics globals
the anchor entity for the joint
if this is null the joint attaches to the world and is static
this determines the direction of rotation for the rotor you can think of it as the direction of the axle

simplesect.para: joints will get tidied up during world destruction, do destroy them if you no longer require them, in the arm example a joint is created and destroyed every time an object is caught and released

briefdescription.para: given a body it will remove it and its geoms from ODE's world

detaileddescription.para:
this is intended to be an internal function that might have use externally you would normally use FreeEntity
As well as freeing all associated metadata it will also remove the body and its geoms from the physics world

parameterdescription.para: the dBodyID you want to free the attached meta data for

briefdescription.para: draws the static geometries

detaileddescription.para:
As static geometries have no bodies they are handled a little different this will draw all the dGeomID's that are registed on the physics context static lists
all geoms on the statics list must have attached geomInfo
ctx
the graphics context
pctx
the physics context

briefdescription.para: Generate a random float in the specified range.

parameterdescription.para: Minimum value (inclusive)
Maximum value (inclusive)

simplesect.para: Random float between min and max
Uses rand() from stdlib - consider seeding with srand() for better randomness

briefdescription.para: Step the physics simulation forward.

detaileddescription.para: This function advances the physics simulation by stepping the world forward using fixed time steps. It handles the frame time accumulation and performs multiple physics steps if necessary to maintain simulation stability and accuracy.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the physics context containing the world and state

simplesect.para: Number of physics steps performed this frame
Uses dWorldQuickStep for faster but less accurate simulation
Maximum number of steps is limited by maxPsteps to prevent spiral of death
dWorldQuickStep

briefdescription.para: frees an entity

detaileddescription.para:
this is essentially destroying the entity it is no longer part of the world
if iterrating through the global entity list while calling this, ensure you have stored the next node in the chain, for use at the end of the while loop as obviously node->next won't work
physCtx
physics context
ent
the entity to destroy

briefdescription.para: sets the limits of travel for a piston

detaileddescription.para: min must be smaller than max values can be negative

parameterdescription.para: the ODE joint id of the joint you want to change
the low end stop point
the high end stop point

briefdescription.para: creates a piston using two entities as its base on extending sections

detaileddescription.para: both entities should be positioned and oriented before calling this, they MUST NOT be in exactly the same position, as the vector between them is used as the axis for the piston

parameterdescription.para: the physics context
the base entity
the extending entity
the maximum force the piston can use

briefdescription.para: set an ODE matrix to the same as a Raylib Matrix

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the Raylib matrix
a pointer to an ODE matrix

briefdescription.para: sets a raylib matrix from an ODE rotation matrix

parameterdescription.para: a pointer to the ODE matrix
a pointer to a Raylib Matrix

memberdef.argsstring: (PhysicsContext *physCtx, GraphicsContext *graphics, Vector3 pos, Vector3 direction, int count, float sectionLen, float baseWidth, float strength)
memberdef.name: CreateMultiPiston

briefdescription.para: set a MultiPiston's velocity

detaileddescription.para: While setting all the join velocities in the piston it also ensures all the bodies are active

parameterdescription.para: the multipiston you want to change the speed of
the speed you want the piston set to

briefdescription.para: sets to bodies orientation to align with a vector

parameterdescription.para: the ODE body id you want to orient
the vector you want the body oriented along

briefdescription.para: pins an entity to the world

detaileddescription.para: This joint will attempt to keep the position and orientation of the body static, position and rotate the body as needed before calling this

parameterdescription.para: physics context
The entity to pin to the world

simplesect.para: the joint id of the constraint
